TITLE: Homebuilder sentiment drops for fourth straight month, as rising rates push housing to 'an inflection point'
SUMMARY: Sharply higher mortgage rates are causing homebuyers to pull back, and homebuilder sentiment dropped as a result.

TITLE: Retail sales rose 0.5% in March amid inflation jump; import prices hit 11-year high
SUMMARY: Retail sales were expected to increase 0.6% in March, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Fed's Waller sees likelihood of multiple half-point interest rate hikes ahead
SUMMARY: Getting inflation under control will require raising interest rates at a faster pace than normal, Fed board member Christopher Waller said Wednesday.

TITLE: Supplier prices rose 11.2% from a year ago in March, the biggest gain on record
SUMMARY: The PPI, which measures the prices paid by wholesalers, increased 11.2% from a year ago, the most in a series going back to November 2010.

TITLE: Consumer prices rose 8.5% in March, slightly hotter than expected and the highest since 1981
SUMMARY: The consumer price index for March was expected to increase 8.4% from a year ago, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: March's runaway energy prices and higher food costs could mean hottest consumer inflation since 1981
SUMMARY: Consumer price inflation in March is expected to have risen the most since December 1981, driven by higher food costs, rising rents and runaway energy prices.

TITLE: White House says it expects inflation to be 'extraordinarily elevated' in new report
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is bracing for the Labor Department's consumer price index report to show that inflation is "extraordinarily elevated."

TITLE: 25% of Americans felt financially stressed all the time last year, CNBC + Acorns Invest in You survey found
SUMMARY: 60% of people with a household income under $50,000 said they're under more financial stress now than they were a year ago: CNBC + Acorns Invest in You survey.

TITLE: Consumer fears over inflation hit a record high in March, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: Worries are increasing over inflation, with new Federal Reserve data showing a record-high fear over surging prices.

TITLE: Inflation is hammering the voters who will soon decide some key midterm races
SUMMARY: Prices are rising at a dramatic rate in states including Georgia and Arizona, which will host two of 2022's most important midterm Senate races.

TITLE: As inflation bites and America's mood darkens, higher-income consumers are cutting back, too
SUMMARY: The top income bracket spends the most among American consumers, but its strength amid inflation may be overstated, according to a new CNBC survey.

TITLE: Here's how the Fed raising interest rates can help get inflation lower, and why it could fail
SUMMARY: The view that higher rates help stamp out inflation is essentially an article of faith, based on long-held economic gospel. But how does it really work?

TITLE: Fed's Bullard says interest rate policy is 'behind the curve,' but it's making progress
SUMMARY: The Fed needs to raise rates substantially to control inflation but may not be as "behind the curve" as it appears, St. Louis Fed President James Bullard said.

TITLE: Weekly jobless claims fell to 166,000 last week, the lowest level since 1968
SUMMARY: Initial filings for unemployment dropped to 166,000, well below the Dow Jones estimate of 200,000 and 5,000 below the previous week's total

TITLE: Fed officials plan to shrink the balance sheet by $95 billion a month, meeting minutes indicate
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve on Wednesday released minutes from its March 15-16 policy meeting.

TITLE: Yellen warns that war in Ukraine will have 'enormous' global economic impact
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen cautioned Wednesday that Russia's attack on Ukraine could cause a major hit to the global economy.

TITLE: Watch Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen speak live on the global financial system
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen testifies Wednesday before the House Financial Services Committee on the state of international finance.

TITLE: Fed's Patrick Harker is 'acutely concerned' about inflation, sees 'deliberate' rate hikes
SUMMARY: Philadelphia Fed President Patrick Harker joined the chorus warning about inflation and the interest rate hikes needed to control rising prices.

TITLE: Key people from the Fed spooked the markets — here's what they said
SUMMARY: Investors didn't like what they heard from the Fed's Lael Brainard and Mary Daly, sending major averages considerably lower on the day.

TITLE: Fed's Mary Daly says high inflation 'is as harmful as not having a job,' pledges rate hikes ahead
SUMMARY: San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly is worried about inflation, telling an audience Tuesday that the high cost of living is causing a heavy burden on society.

TITLE: Fed's Brainard sees balance sheet reduction soon and 'at a rapid pace'
SUMMARY: Brainard said policy tightening will include a speedy reduction in the balance sheet and a steady pace of interest rate increases.

TITLE: 81% of U.S. adults are worried about a recession hitting this year, survey finds
SUMMARY: More than 80% of adults think the U.S. economy is likely to experience a recession in 2022, according to the CNBC + Acorns Invest in You survey.

TITLE: Inflation fears force Americans to rethink financial choices, CNBC and Acorns survey says
SUMMARY: Americans are more financially stressed than a year ago, with 48% thinking about higher prices all the time, a CNBC + Acorns Invest in You survey found.

TITLE: Here’s what consumers plan to cut back on if prices continue to surge
SUMMARY: People plan to trim spending on food, driving and vacations to keep up with inflation, according to CNBC + Acorns Invest in You survey.

TITLE: Dimon says confluence of inflation, Ukraine war may 'dramatically increase risks ahead' for U.S.
SUMMARY: Jamie Dimon's annual letter to JPMorgan shareholders, read widely in business circles, took a more downcast tone from his missive just last year.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs are — in one chart
SUMMARY: Post-Covid rebounds in the leisure and hospitality and business sectors continued last month and helped drive a strong March jobs report.

TITLE: Economy added 431,000 jobs in March despite worries over slowing growth
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to rise by 490,000 in March, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: The Fed's preferred inflation gauge rose 5.4% in February, the highest since 1983
SUMMARY: The personal consumption expenditures price index increased 5.4% from the same period in 2021, the biggest jump going back to April 1983.

TITLE: Companies added 455,000 jobs in March, slightly more than expected, ADP says
SUMMARY: Private payrolls expanded by 455,000 for the month, the firm said, about in line with the Dow Jones estimate of 450,000.

TITLE: Mortgage refinance demand plunges 60%, as rates hit their highest level since 2018
SUMMARY: A sharp increase in mortgage rates causes a plunge in refinance demand.
